abstract: Floyd Norris High & Low Finance column says split Congress is making muddle of Dodd-Frank financial reform law; notes key components of law, ban on proprietary trading and rule that mortgage lenders must retain at least 10 percent risk on loans, are being significantly watered down.
snippet: A Congress that wants to have it both ways is creating a muddle of the regulations under the Dodd-Frank Act.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: A Congress that wants to have it both ways is creating a muddle of the regulations under the Dodd-Frank Act.

headline.main: Bank Rules That Serve Two Masters
headline.seo: New Dodd-Frank Rules Muddled by Congress That Wants It Both Ways
headline.print_headline: Bank Rules That Serve Two Masters
